settings.title: General settings
settings.backupAndRestoreText: This tool only saves data in the so-called local storage of the browser. If you reset it, all your data will be gone. If you do not want to lose the data, you can download or restore it here.
settings.randomizeText: The random generator for the weekly plan works better if individual tags are assigned to the days. The random generator only selects menus with tags that are also allowed on the corresponding meals. By default, all tags are allowed on all days, times of day are set accordingly.
settings.randomizeHint: Add tags to the week plan with drag and drop
settings.dangerZoneText: Here you can give or revoke your consent to the storage of data in your browser. If you agree, all menus, ingredients, tags, settings etc. will be saved in your browser. You will not be tracked. Attention: If you revoke your consent, all data will be deleted!

font.title: Font
font.text: Yummyplan offers two different fonts: Nanum and OpenDyslexic. Click on the button with the corresponding font to change it. The selected font will be saved in your browser. You can see a preview of the fonts in the buttons.

meals.title: Create, edit and delete menus
meals.introduction: Here you can add new menus, edit existing ones or delete unnecessary ones. A menu consists of a title, optionally a link to a recipe and/or some notes, a list of ingredients and tags.

edit.title: Name of the menu
edit.notes: Notes (page number in the recipe book, for example)

ingredients.title: Create, edit and delete ingredients
ingredients.introduction: Here you can add new ingredients, edit existing ones ore delete unnecessary ones. Ingredients consist of a name and the unit they're measured in.

tags.title: Create, edit and delete tags
tags.introduction: Here you can add new tags, edit existing ones or delete unnecessary ones. A tag consists of a name, a color and an Emoji as an icon.

about.title: About Yummyplan
about.text: Yummyplan was built with Nuxt, Tailwind and Fontawesome and is hosted on Github. It is published under the MIT licence. If errors or bugs are found, or if you want to develop a new feature, you can create a pull request:

donate.title: Donate
donate.text: This tool is free and open source. I built it to make menu planning for a whole week easier and more accessible. Menu planning helps you shop less often and reduce food waste, which is something we should all at least try. Nowadays more than ever. If this tool has helped you and saved you time, buy me a coffee on buymeacoffee:
